title: World Archery Youth Câ€™Ships: India win gold in Under-18 and Under-21 womenâ€™s compound team events
content:
On an especially windy day, Indiaâ€™s women compound archers added to the countryâ€™s medal tally after winning the Under-18 and U-21 team titles at the World Youth Championships in Limerick, Ireland on Thursday.The Indian womenâ€™s under-18 compound team of Aishwarya Sharma, Aditi Swami and Ekta Rani defeated their opponents from the USA for Indiaâ€™s first gold medal of the day. The womenâ€™s team bounced back from behind to edge past Olivia Dean, Liko Arreola and Leann Drake 214-212.Later in the day, the under-21 trio of Avneet Kaur, Parneet Kaur and Pragati prevailed over Mexicoâ€™s Adriana Castillo, Jimenez Valdez and Selene Rodriguez 222-214 to win India their second gold medal of the day.This was Indiaâ€™s third gold medal in the competition. On Wednesday, Priyansh and Avneet had won gold in the under-21 mixed team compound event.It was close! ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨India takes the gold in Limerick with an unbelievable last arrow. ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ğŸ¥‡#WorldArchery pic.twitter.com/CoSPtrzAoBâ€” World Archery (@worldarchery) July 6, 2023

The Indian under-21 team had a strong start in the gold medal match against Mexico, taking a four-point lead in the opening end. By the halfway mark, the trio extended its lead to 10 points and went on to seal the top podium place with a handsome eight-point margin. The trio of Manav Jadhao, Pawan Gat and Ganesh Thirumuru lost by one point to Mexico in the under-18 menâ€™s compound team event, winning silver for India. Despite trailing by eight points after a wayward opening round, the Indian menâ€™s team fought back to lead 163-162 after the third end.But the Indian trio could not maintain its consistency as Mexico closed out the gold medal match 216-215.The under-21 menâ€™s team of Priyansh, Prathamesh Samadhan Jawkar and Kushal Dalal were unable to overcome the USA in the bronze medal compound team match, losing 213-229 and finishing in fourth place.
